## Major

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9471
activity.text:
---

## [Users Login Page](https://care.do.ohc.network/facility/)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ea3ea4bd-74e0-4397-bad9-d7ffca7b2971)

### Major issue

- [ ] The patient login using the phone number OTP is not being generated to the user

Note: the AWS sandbox services we are using require to register the number with the services first, then only the OTP generation will work in the CARE. For now, we can use the static OTP : 45612

- Login with the static OTP is also not possible

### Minor Issue

- [ ] add the translation to the username and password error message in the staff login
- [ ] add the translation to the OTP sent successfully notification for the patient login section

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86cdcaff-71ad-40c8-a876-30ce64cc9812)

- [ ] Add proper error message for incorrect OTP-based patient login on the homepage

---

## [Facility Public Page](https://care.do.ohc.network/facilities?state=1&facility_type=840&page=1&limit=14)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cceaf63f-7c41-4a27-b22d-228d0e1221e9)

### Minor Issue

- [ ] The Facility Type advanced filter on the Facility Public Page is not working because the facility type details are not shown on the card. We can either hide the filter or display the facility type details on the card and fix the related filter functionality. 

### Enhancement

- [ ] Add a back button to the facility public page, which users can use to go back to the initial district selection [page](https://care.do.ohc.network/)
- [ ] Add a login button of the right side top corner, so users can always go to the login page from the public page

---

## [Facility Details Page](https://care.do.ohc.network/facility/0aef5488-ea4d-4280-938a-d6b2fb44df59)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1de0bb78-9cd9-40f0-ae41-ed2b530e728a)

### Minor Issue

- [ ] Only show the doctor users in the facility detail public page for booking appointments, as they are the only users who will be requiring a appointment book (Product Discussion Required)

### Enhancement

- [ ] Add support to search the doctor's name / Qualification in the facility details page

---

## Booking Appointment

### Major Issue

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bd5e4e26-613e-4dcb-9509-78bb63f54cd3)

- [ ] We can use an invalid OTP such as 00000 to login to the appointment portal and register a patient, even though the frontend throws a 400 error, so handle the situation with proper validation and gracefully

### Minor Issue

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/020ff3a4-6fa9-4de8-b3a0-c00e55a9fd9c)

- [ ] Add fine text for age mentioning to the user that, only the year of birth will be saved if they are using the age field

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9d564f5d-6361-48c4-9595-19b0f604edcc)

- [ ] Add support to the current address field allowing users to type address in multiple lines

---

## [User Details Page](https://care.do.ohc.network/users/nibras-doctor/availability)

### Major Issue

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b34ef0cc-508c-4859-ac39-3a0098dfe80d)

- [ ] When we try to create an availability schedule for a user, **without mentioning the weekly schedule**, submitting the form crashes the page. Additionally, each time we open the Availability section on the user's detail page of the same user, the page kept on crashing

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/03737a76-dc76-4e56-b141-be84d76c1cc3)

- [ ] When we try to create a schedule exception for a user, its throwing 404 error in the frontend

### Minor Issue

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c4c0189-5abd-4be4-98b6-8e1953064ba9)

- [ ] Replace the return to care icon with Return to Linked Facilities
- [ ] Repositon the icon and button of no home facility so, we can avoid unwanted scroller in this page

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/803a381d-550b-4eb3-bd36-09670e69f4d5)

- [ ] When there is no exception available for a user, the loader is keep on loading infinitely

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4f02df1a-dac5-4423-a4e0-13214ac2b216)

- [ ] The weekly schedule field in the create schedule template form is not properly responsive

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d779635f-d7e5-4c8b-b295-3f0e36a69882)

- [ ] the info card in the session section of create schedule template is not properly responsive

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/81348104-31c2-489d-914a-b04c34e174a3)

- [ ] the return to CARE button in the crashing page is not redirecting properly to the loginpage 

### Enhancement

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/188d19c0-c3ae-47ce-98ab-ab085fae4182)

- [ ] Add an option to edit the existing schedule template of the user

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/babb2266-3cb6-4152-9eb0-3ed3981dd831)

- [ ] Use color coding for the dates to clearly indicate their availability status—such as available, fully booked, nearly full, and unavailable—making it easier to understand availability at a glance without needing to click on each date.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9400
activity.text:
## Fix the below Issue before requesting another review

- [ ] Add a validation rule to ensure the phone number field accepts exactly 10 digits. Currently, patients can be created with a 9-digit number. Ensure proper error messages are displayed.
- [ ] Add a mandatory validation for the age field in the patient registration form.
- [ ] Unable to create a new patient / Edit a existing patient by mentioning patient age only
- [ ] When a patient is created with a DOB, and we later visit the patient’s edit page, the DOB field is replaced by the calculated age based on the provided DOB. If we manually switch back to the DOB field, it appears blank.
- [ ] the ration card details are not been stored while creating new patient or updating existing one
- [ ] the occupation details are been stored but when we open the edit registration form page, the field is blank

## Issue that can be taken in another PR

- [ ] Add a translation for non-binary sex to transgender in patient registration form
- [ ] Reset the patient search field when the related badge are been removed
- [ ] Add a placeholders for all dropdown as per the figma file
- [ ] The tab switching functionality does not properly use colors, making it difficult for users to identify the currently active tab on the initial load of the 'All Patients' page.
- [ ] Restore Draft feature is missing in the new patient registration form

## Question

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b58678f5-fdf3-42b7-a29d-766bddb24b51)

- [ ] When filling out the patient registration form, the patient transfer form pops up for matching phone number. Can't we consider implementing this workflow in the patient search instead? Since we are already searching for all patients with the same number, couldn't the workflow be incorporated there?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8963
activity.text:
> Hey @nihal467 I replaced all instances of cy.wait() with cy.intercept() and dynamic waits.
> 
> However, the following issues arise when certain cy.wait() statements are removed:
> 
> In FacilityHomepage.cy.ts, removing cy.wait(2000) at line 177 causes the test case to fail because the logged-in nurse cannot see the notify message on the noticeboard. Additionally, intercepts are already included, so there is no possibility of using additional intercept here.
> 
> In PatientRegistration.tsx, removing cy.wait(3000) at line 158 results in a test case failure, indicating that after selecting the gender as "Female," the "Is antenatal?" checkbox is not displayed. No intercept is triggered when the gender selection is clicked.
> 
> In patientFileUpload.ts, removing cy.wait(2000) at line 30 within the verifyUploadFilePresence function causes the "User-level Based Permission for File Modification" test case to fail, while other test cases pass. I attempted to include intercepts, but the issue persists at the same point.
> 
> Could you please look into this?

will look into these, can you clear the requested changes

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9289
activity.text:
@samholics The issue arises because the patient is marked as "live" on the patient details page due to their admission to another facility. Since you are accessing the page as  admin,  you can view the details. However, ideally, once a patient is discharged, the patient details page should not be accessible to staff members

This problem occurs because the patient details page is shared across CARE and is not specific to a particular facility.

To address this, we need to define the ideal behavior. Some potential solutions include:

- Removing the "live" status badge from the patient details page.
- Updating the "live" badge to display the name of the current live facility, providing more context.

Or Exploring other approaches to better align the page behavior with the expected workflows after discussing with the users and product teams, meanwhile I am blocking this issue and assigning it to you

activity.text:
> It was removed as the submit button is disabled initially. `facilityPage.saveAndExitBedCapacityForm();` this function tries to click it but can't, hence tests were failing

There's no need to delete the test. Instead, you can reposition the test steps as follows:

1. Select the appropriate dropdown options.
2. Skip filling in the "Total" and "Current Count" fields.
3. Submit the form.

This approach will allow you to verify whether the appropriate error message is displayed to users after your PR changes

activity.text:
> @nihal467 issue is in facility export test but that only I am unable to understand why it is failing in CI/CD because locally everything is passing succesfully

I understand that it’s failing in the CI/CD pipeline. When you investigated, what did you find? If the tests passed when the capacity export was kept separate, it could indicate an issue with the function itself or another underlying cause. Possible reasons might include the capacity export taking longer to generate the report, multiple requests being fired, or the backend not responding as expected.

Please investigate the issue at the component level and start a thread in the channel to share your findings after completing a thorough investigation.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8727
activity.text:
> In that case should we over engineer? The page would render the empty message right 🤔

Yes, rather than disabling the button, we can simply throw an error on the frontend stating, "You don't have access to this file," replacing the current behavior of redirecting restricted users to a 404 page.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8727
ohcnetwork/care_fe#8727
activity.text:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43657341-3f7e-48e3-9e2d-5c964d63672d)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1347e2f4-8fb0-4d93-9eb0-8039f717d85e)

@bodhish Currently, admins can access all routes of the disabled button in the patient details page from the patient consultation page, but this approach isn’t ideal for effectively restricting access. Many users with district admin roles rely on this access to manage certain data.

The main issue we’re aiming to resolve is to ensure that non-admin users cannot access consultation files of a facility that isn’t linked to their user ID. If a non-admin user who is not linked to a facility tries to access facility data, either by clicking on a patient card to view consultations from the patient list page or by using the "View Consultation" button on the patient details page, an error message—such as "You don't have access to this file"—should be displayed instead of redirecting them to a 404 page.

Could you review his deploy preview along with my comment, and then provide a response?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8977
activity.text:
@JavidSumra 

- in general, use already existing helper function in commands.ts file and already declared reusable function
- for any form submission or new page load, add cy. intercept to make sure the API responds properly and the page is fully loaded before your next line of test is executed
- never use classes if there is a possibility we can add id to the elements
- always do a manual test of the workflow you are planning to write test and plan properly before start coding

activity.text: @Rishith25 The cy.wait command was initially added in the test to prevent flakiness. The issue was created to replace hardcorded wait with cy.intercept, ensuring that tests dynamically wait for the necessary API to load and verify that the page is fully loaded before executing the next step in the test.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8926
activity.text:
@JavidSumra you don't need to create a new patient, we already have live patient present in the patient tab, once you load the dummy data,

the follow should be:

1. Go to the patient tab
2. click on any patient card, with live consultation
3. once the consultation dashboard is open, click on the patient details buttons on the top right corner
4. once the new page (Patient Details Page) is loaded, scroll down to the sample test button and create a sample test request.
5. Upon, successfully submitting the sample test request, verify in the patient details page, under the sample test history section, you are able to view the request you created
6. Now, go to the sample test board, using the sidebar
7. search for your patient name and verify the card is visible
8. click on the sample test details and verify the patient details are properly visible in that page

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8744
activity.text:
Nikhil from the screenshot, you are not doing the configuration backend properly

Note: Care_fe is under https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe and care backend is under https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care

steps to run the docker : 

1. Clone the backend repo: https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care (backend)
2. now since you are using the docker app, open the vs code and you are in the correct branch
3. type `docker compose -f docker-compose.yaml -f docker-compose.local.yaml up -d` in your vs code panel
4. now open the docker app and check all the containers are running
5. now open the celery container and view the log, verify all the migration is completed
6. open the localhost:9000 and you will be able to view a similar page as below: 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b8966840-bc6b-4f71-8751-c8816e058314)

7. once the entire backend is up, run the command in vs code for loading the dummy data `docker exec care-backend-1 python manage.py load_dummy_data` 

Once all the steps are followed properly, your backend is fully up.

Connect the frontend to the backend:

- in the frontend , open the .env file and replace the REACT_CARE_API_URL=https://careapi.ohc.network to REACT_CARE_API_URL=http://localhost:9000

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8727
activity.text:
- [ ] Any non-admin users, should be able to access only the consultation card from facility there are linked, if the patient has any consultation history from facility where they are not linked, then the button on that particular card should be disabled

step 1: Admit Patient A to Facility A, then discharge them from Facility A. Repeat this process for Facility B and Facility C.
Step 2: After these admissions and discharges, Patient A will have a consultation history from Facilities A, B, and C.
Step 3: Log in with a nurse's user ID that is linked only to Facilities A and B.
Step 4: Now re-admit Patient A to one of the facilities (either A or B) where the nurse is linked.
Step 5: Access Patient A’s consultation history. In the consultation cards, the consultation button for Facility C should be disabled, as the nurse is not linked to Facility C.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8738
activity.text:
Conclusion:
Due to GitHub Actions' sequential job structure, the current remaining approach would be is to run the setup in one runner, expose the services via Cloudflare/ngrok, and have another runner connect and run parallel Cypress tests.

Summary of Approaches We Tried:

Initial Approach (All Tests in One Runner): Tried running backend, frontend, and Cypress tests in a single runner, but the Cypress test action download everything again

Two-Job Approach (Split Setup and Tests): Separated the setup and Cypress test jobs, but GitHub Actions' sequential processing meant the Cypress tests couldn't start until the setup was fully done.

Background Setup in One Job: Tried running backend and frontend in the background while starting Cypress tests in parallel, but since GitHub Actions run sequentially, the 6 parallel node for Cypress tests wouldn't start together while the backend is running.

Exposing Backend/Frontend (Cloudflare/ngrok): Finally, I used a separate runner for setup, exposing backend/frontend services via Cloudflare/ngrok, so Cypress tests could run in parallel without reinitializing the services.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8670
activity.text:
Closing the POC of Playwright migration because of the following reasons:

- Flaky tests are still occurring even after using the await functionality.
- We cannot freeze a particular step in the test video replay to understand which APIs were called during a specific action.
- Migrating all the files, even with a specifically configured chatbot, can be energy- and time-consuming, which doesn’t provide real value as debugging the code might take time.
- For integrating BrowserStack and commenting on each URL PR preview, we need to run separate GitHub actions and maintain all configurations ourselves, whereas Cypress offers single-click cloud integration, which is easier.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8714
activity.text:
Closing the POC of Playwright migration because of the following reasons:

- Flaky tests are still occurring even after having the await functionality
- Migrating all the files even with a specifically configured chatbot can be energy and time-confusing, which doesn't give real value as debugging the code might take time
- for integrating BrowserStack, and commenting on each URL PR preview, we need to run separate GitHub actions plus maintain all configurations ourselves whereas Cypress is a single-click cloud integration which is easier.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8670
activity.text:
> Jest

- Cypress lacks auto-waiting for delayed API responses; Playwright handles this automatically, reducing flaky tests.
- Cypress 13.0+ discontinued third-party integrations for test coverage report generation 
- Cypress runs tests in one browser at a time; Playwright supports in-built multi-browser parallel testing.
- Cypress is slower compared to Playwright.

Note: I am still working on the POC to understand if it's worth doing the migration

- Jest isn't ideal for E2E testing and lacks a head UI, making debugging slower with only console logs and breakpoints.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8504
activity.text:
@shivankacker 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5c0fffe9-e18a-4d99-aab4-ddb69e28c4f2)

- [ ] When you open the date and time component in the patient consultation page, the entire form is scrolled to the right side, making it hard for the user to see what is the field heading since they are left-aligned
- [ ] Once a user clicks on a specific time, then the component should auto-close

- [ ] We had an existing behavior where typing "12092024" would automatically format the input as 12/09/2024. This behavior was removed in your PR. Please revert the change and retain the auto-formatting in the component.
- [ ] When the user types "12092024" and moves out of focus of the element or switches tabs, the entered data resets to the current date and time in the discharge pop-up.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/990589f0-5a95-419a-a403-c5c59965bf4c)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8335
activity.text:
Steps to Access Facility Middleware Page

1. Go to the facility tab
2. click on the view facility button on any facility card
3. once you are in the page click on the manage facility button
4. from the dropdown, click the config facility button
5. you will be seeing the below page

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3117f03c-bfce-4f00-a90c-e4bc1fa554c9)

steps to access location middleware page

1. Follow the above step 1-3
2. then from dropdown click the location management button
3. click on the add location button on the top right corner
4. you will be seeing the below page

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56c5a4a2-a0dc-41b2-98ce-33493a018fed)

steps to access asset middleware page

1. follow the top step 1-3
2. then from the dropdown click the view asset button
3. click on any camera asset card ( It will have a camera icon ) , case not available create a new asset
4. now click on the configuration button
5. you will be seeing the below page

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf630ee3-37df-4a99-8e1d-7ae0c2ea08be)

- middleware preference for a device is given for the one available on the asset configuration page, if not available there, its be taken from the location management page if not available it is also it been taken from the facility middleware page.

- the action items are mentioned under the description of solution

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8183
activity.text:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a999e312-0280-45b7-8d5a-cf6ab9318cb5)

- [ ] When we use relative timing in the investigation, the transcribe fails to fetch the data, let's say today at 3:00 P.m., so the transcribe is not able to fetch today's data and combine it the time mentioned in the comment audio, to fill in the investigation.

Note: 

- In the audio, if we give the exact date and time, the investigation time field is filled properly
- At the same time, if we use relative usage in symptoms, let's say the patient had a fever two days ago and was cured today, the date is auto-filled properly by the scribe. In the symptoms field, it works with date or relative days

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8799f4e-05b1-4e0e-bec8-442ac50c0a10)

Transcribe Data 

The patient is having a round type of progress note and he is suggested to have two investigation and first investigation will be biochemistry test, urine test, with repetitive investigation of frequency 6 hours and regarding the investigation, leave a note mentioning it has to be followup with doctor all the time and second investigation suggestion will be blood test today 3:00 Pm in the evening with note looking ok.

after this, the patient is having a symptom of fever and sore throat start two days ago and cured today. the patient is nasal discharge started on 31/07/2024 and the treatment is still going on. the patient is again having another symptoms which is nasal discharge started on 31/07/2024

activity.text:
@skks1212 

**Bug**

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/492d68ab-dfa4-44a1-a292-63712a8e134a)

- [ ] as per issue, if all existing uploaded files are archived and no active file are present, the consent missing badge should appear in the consultation, but in the PR, it is not behaving as expect 

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/b0921276-3abb-4c0d-b852-4b1355bdd4a7)

- [ ] once a file is archived, you should replace upload by user name with the username who archived it
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/616c2b63-4c4d-4fb5-90b2-8c2aa88e3a01)
- [ ] since you are replacing username based on the above comment, add the created by and at details in the more details pop-up

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/6716edeb-a816-4bd1-b342-7e615501fef2)

- [ ] currently, in the more info pop-up everything is center aligned, doesn't look good, as a mockup i tried playing around with the UI, can you look into the scope making the pop-up UI better

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/3776e375-c113-471c-8ff6-58d6dc8143aa)
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/ddef36eb-0d88-4005-a9a7-749e51607de6)


- [ ] when user uploads a .xlsx file, the process will get completed, but preview mode will fail. In existing consultation file upload, .xlsx format doesn't have preview. So, rather than making it similar to file upload to handle .xlsx, take an opinion from @aparnacoronasafe / @gigincg and allow certain type of file only to be uploaded in the consent page

Additional Enhancement for Users

- [ ] Add a edit button for users, in case they want to modify the file name

@Sulochan-khadka newly added active medicine is getting by-default collapsed state, which is not expected, only discontinued medicine should be in collapsed state bydefault.

Steps to replicate 

1. Create a new medicine and manually collapse it
2. then create two more medicines.
3. Then you will be seeing except the latest added medicine, all other ones are collapsed

activity.text:
@hrit2773 we are having a cypress test failure, fix it

Navigate to the "patient_spec" folder, then locate the "patient_registration.cy.ts" file. In this file, update the Occupation selection component. Currently, it uses "cy.clickAndSelectOption". Change this to reuse the "cy.searchAndSelectOption" function as you change the occupation component from a select form field to an autocomplete form field.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7438
activity.text:
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/bb06c5d2-b088-4c37-b1e0-d0e4a84eedc2)

**Above is PR deployment**

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/de02abbd-6c37-4e65-b9c9-b38d0f56a8cd)

**Above is the current staging**

@r-nikhilkumar When there is a log update present for a patient, and the MEWS relevant data are missing, the MEWS score should be displayed as "-" Upon hovering over it, the related tooltip should show the missing data and related information. This functionality is currently working properly in the staging environment but is missing in your pull request.

It is a basic functionality of the MEWS score. Therefore, I kindly request you to familiarize yourself with the function first, understand its functionality, make the necessary changes, conduct self QA of the function, and then submit it for review.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7504
activity.text:
@MjStar24 I am closing this PR for the following reasons:

- It's an EPIC issue, intended for creating sub-issues to be assigned to individuals.
- You've submitted a PR that only covers the headings of the sub-issues without addressing any related activities.
- The Cypress tests themselves are failing.

**Recommended Method**: Comment on the issue specifying which part of the EPIC issue you want to work on, have the core team create the sub-issue, and only then proceed with your work on the PR.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7197
activity.text:
Test 1: Record an Audio and download the file.

Record an audio.
Verify its success through notification and reflection in the list.
Verify the file and ensure its reflection in the list as well as notification.
Try to download the file and verify its success using API response with cy.intercept.

By performing the above tasks, you can remove the following tests:

"Verify uploaded file can be edited by author"
"Verify that file download is possible for district admin and above"
"Verify that file download is possible for author"

Test 2: Upload a File and archive it

Upload a file and verify its reflection in the list.
Archive the file and verify the file list along with the reason.

By performing the above tasks, you can remove the test "Archive file and verify it."

Test 3: User-level Based Permission for File Modification

Upload a file using Nurse ID-1 and download it.
Edit the file using Nurse ID-1.
Log in as Nurse ID-2 and verify that the file can't be edited.
Log in as district admin and verify that the file can be edited.

You can remove the test "Verify that file download is possible for users below district admin."

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7197
activity.text:
@AshrafMd-1 

way of approach should be like , use two nurse type and one district admin

Test - 1 Part-1 : Verify the uploaded file can only be modified by the author, district admin, and above users.
- [ ] First, upload a file to a patient file using the nurse user ID-1, and edit the file successfully.
- [ ] Now, log out as nurse user ID-1 and log in as nurse user ID-2. Then try to edit the same file. Expected behavior: "Nurse user ID-2 shouldn't be able to edit the file uploaded by nurse user ID-1." Verify this behavior.
- [ ] Now, log out as nurse user ID-2 and log in as a district admin. Edit the file uploaded by nurse user ID-1. Expected behavior: "The admin should be able to edit the file uploaded by nurse user ID-1."

Test - 1 Part-2 : Verify file download is possible for all users.

- [ ] Verify that the download functionality is working for nurse user ID-1 and the district admin, along with the part-1 test.

@AshrafMd-1 Answer to the question : Only check for district admin and nurse userID

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#6217
activity.text:
@suprabathk 
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/1577efb9-7f41-4599-9411-e11b6ff45479)

The bug here is that, initially, when we click the last service detail, the calendar sometimes, becomes only half visible, so, when we try to click on the date to select, on the first click, it makes the component fully visible, and on the next click only the date selection takes place.

The above situation shouldn't be the ideal case, on the first click itself the user should be able to select the date

Note: This bug won't occur, if the user manually scrolls and makes the component fully visible first and click on the date.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#6224
activity.text:
**pointer by QA, can be an enhancement on later version**

- feature works well but few pointers to highlight

1. unless we reload the page manually, newly send messages won't arrive in the doctor notes

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/b9362f06-6ed9-486f-a1c5-15a8a8ab88ea)

2. in the notification no details are been shown such as : Who send it, for which patient, and what is the content of the message 

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/43d5c2d1-ac55-49c7-86c7-637355d0bdd4)

3. We can't write notes in two rows and to send a notice message, we need to explicitly click the send button ( most of the users prefer enter button to send it ) 

![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/dcaf22cc-2747-4d57-911f-7d46652f8334)

4. the system notification are not properly redirected to the respective doctor note

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#6223
activity.text:
**Initial Review of QA pointers**

**Works Good**

- Camera Feed privacy is working properly
- Multiple user camera access control working good

**Need to work on before tomorrow's EOD**

- Camera Boundary preview is not working, even though in the network tab, the requests are coming in, and the camera is not moving to show the boundary of the camera view.
- Camera boundary preset is hard to set, as it keeps on rotating to a default preset
- When I am moving the camera, to set a boundary, on each click I get a notification, so change it to show notification only when we set a preset of left, right, or any one side and move to the next one.
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/ee33f4ad-74d1-4102-9437-8973301a085b)

- The UI shows multiple users and the way the subscribe button is shown not give a good user experience.
- when the second user is trying to move the camera, even though the camera is not moving as expected but, there is no notification showing camera is already in use, request the access to gain control, something like that

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#5912
activity.text:
@aparnacoronasafe 
![image](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/assets/57055998/5f2a857f-2654-4f55-b203-62bd1c2cc7f3)

Initially, when a user clicks the "Discharge Summary" button to generate it, the discharge summary starts generating. Sometimes, it will be generated instantly, while others may take some time. Once the generation is completed, a "Discharge Summary" section will be visible in the files section, where you can find all the discharge summaries generated for the patient.

Note: if there is no discharge summary present for the patient, the discharge summary section in the file section will be invisible

activity.text:
@aparnacoronasafe 

https://care.coronasafe.in/facility/53a7266a-ed34-4616-85eb-7ae1be57d2cc/patient/4ae3b7de-800d-4b41-8ac9-00dbb741fe9f/consultation/54959916-9496-49ea-9ebe-e1ff579e5557

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/226821072-3e58f58d-6d6c-4fd0-a9fd-9b8856e67541.png)

**Issue:** 

A Patient named "Test-daily-hospitalreport" in the facility "test-march-thirdweek" was initially admitted to the hospital
- on 01/03/2023 to a regular bed
- later on 10/03/2023 he was shifted from a regular bed to icu.
- again on 15/03/2023 he was again shifted back to regular bed.

When we go to the patient tab, apply a filter, admitted to "regular", it is generating a list of all the patients in the regular bed, and we are not able to apply a filter to see, which all patients were admitted in a regular bed, for the period 08/03/2022 to 14/03/2022 because the admit date filter in the advance filter, is only checking the initial admit date of the patient and not the bed change date of the patient

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#1787

activity.text:
@aparnacoronasafe comment your opinion on the below points :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/211737338-56685bf3-e015-499e-9470-726daf4c9fbe.png)

- [ ] even though I mark a patient in the consultation form as declared dead, the particular patient consultation page, is still active. I think, once a patient is declared dead in a consultation form, the particular patient consultation page should be inactive and we should be able to generate a death report.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/211738165-5c6cc18b-f1e3-4a70-aaf8-a12e2c537f9b.png)

- [ ] shall we remove the expired option from the droplist on the patient creation form, as there is no need for it, as we are capturing it from the consultation page now?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/211738827-fc1a9b7e-0b69-467b-b10d-d52fd57c4e8c.png)

- [ ] when a patient is declared dead, we should be having a field cause of death in the create consultation page

Marking it for team discussion required for discussing above points

activity.text:
@Ashesh3 After the EOD discussion, we have decided to do the following 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/202215276-7bcd5f12-9606-4b36-9bb4-fec8b5140428.png)

- [ ] remove the age, which is adjacent to the gender since we are already showing the age along with the name
- [ ] move the badges from the bottom of the card to the right side corner
- [ ] move the blood group from the bottom to the right side, adjacent to the gender.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/202216039-739a978a-5983-4246-a982-2579d152c25c.png)

- [ ] make the tooltip data in a way that, the first row shows the user name, the second row shows the user id and the third row shows the role

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/202216967-aa838a02-0535-4133-a1fd-090852207bf4.png)

- [ ] when a patient is admitted, then only show the admitted on date, and remove admitted - YES

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/202217278-357a2b93-ecf1-4ef4-8018-179d3125d25a.png)

- [ ] when a patient is not admitted, then we should be only showing admitted - No , and remove the admitted on date from the page

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#2402
activity.text:
@gigincg @cp-Coder test failed

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170321721-f53953cf-9ccc-4bf6-aff0-ad067fd63402.jpg)

- username and password box is coloured with a blue line
- login button is having a black border

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170321908-f2f6aa2f-3b2c-43cc-be6c-70b493d7298d.jpg)

- the notification tab is having by default a black border

![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170321999-07a0ccff-b549-4355-bc72-aa75f7cb18c3.jpg)

- it is hard to view the facility and the patients button in the facility page.

![4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322147-3be093c6-57a3-4530-8d2b-27bdbebb62c1.jpg)

- in the facility detail page, all the buttons are having black borders, which is not looking good in the UI
- the separation by a line for the information on oxygen, bed capacity, doctors list, and corona triage is missing

![5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322260-5177d99d-320b-45a6-91a5-40cca57d74ed.jpg)

- all the heading and the cards are overlapping to each other

![6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322350-1e8feb20-5489-4a17-86f7-42dd72f76577.jpg)

- in the assets, there is no lines present to separate them.
- the search box and all the buttons are having black border

![7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322482-22c48ae7-dbfa-479b-a2e0-dd2b722efb7e.jpg)

- the search by name box size is high and overlapping with the button
- live and discharge button is not working smoothly, and the colour of the button is blue with live and dischage
- there is no line separating the patient names
- the add details of a patient button is having black border
- download live list and download all patient buttons having a border would look good.

![8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322731-7667775f-0295-4300-8691-20e86d0afa59.jpg)

- all the buttons are having black border
- all the user cards are assembles in vertical, and there is a lot of white space been wasted on the right side

![9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170322909-19a0c85d-8561-485a-938b-742e4dbc7e4e.jpg)

- the active, completed, list view and filters buttons are not looking good
- the datas in the shifting cards look scrambled
- patient name box is having higher space and black border
- all details button is having black border

![10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170323031-92977ba2-e830-4a10-9e32-40755a63a758.jpg)

- the black border is present for the back button and referral letter
- Details of the patient are looking scrambled, a change of UI will be better

![11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170323201-119d776f-6eea-40e0-925b-54b2655541fd.jpg)

- doctor video, create investigation and all the buttons are having black border
- when we are clicking the update, summary, etc... button, they are not showing any indication that it is been selected.
- in the nursing analysis, all the cards are overlapping.

![12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170323451-373aaadd-ae35-4f02-817c-684b2dfe3bdd.jpg)

- in the IO Balance plot, intake and output are having black border
- all the graphs are not having any borders

![13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/170323612-c65d8fa3-7fc8-40bf-bc04-88bc0317c90f.jpg)

- all the boxes having the black border
- the boxes are overlapping
- the boxes are over sized
